communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

My name is chiara cross, the best friend of Colbee Cammarata, Hodgman who died at the everett dam on 10/9/22. I was there with him along with my friend Emily. I called the police department a couple days after the incident asking for more details. I’m worried my brain has distorted some of the memory from that call and I’m looking to make sure I heard the phone call correctly..the police officer said someone was up there with him and that’s why he fell. Im look for clarity to make sure that’s correct. I have no means to hurt or go after anyone, I wanna make sure when I’m talking about it I’m saying the right thing.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

11/01/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR153946 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam : 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014429-110123 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Your public records request
communications.communication:
Hello Ben,

Your faxed public records request, copy attached, was forwarded to me to process.

I wanted to reach out to clarify the scope of your request. Are there specific words/terms that should be searched, or is there a particular subject matter you are interested in? Even with the fairly narrow date range, the search could produce a number of records pertaining to a variety of subjects, and the responsive records will have to be reviewed individually for any confidential information that may be exempt from disclosure based on Iowa Code Chapter 22. In accordance with our fee schedule<https://transparency.uiowa.edu/faqs/public-records-fee-schedule>, we charge a rate of $30/hour, with one hour free, for the time to retrieve, review, and redact records. Please also note that we are processing a high volume of other requests at the moment, and requests for emails generally take longer for us to complete, due to the legal review required.

Please also be aware that if the search produces any records pertaining to personnel matters, those would likely be exempt from disclosure based on Iowa Code 22.7(11) (confidential personnel records).

Please let me know if you would like to narrow the scope of your request, or if you want to proceed with your request as written. I will be in touch to let you know if there will be costs for the retrieval/review.

Thanks,
Aubree


Aubree Johnson
Public Records Officer
The University of Iowa
351 Plaza Centre One
Iowa City, IA 52242
public-records@uiowa.edu<mailto:public-records@uiowa.edu>

NOTICE TO RECIPIENT: THIS MESSAGE AND ANY RESPONSE TO IT MAY CONSTITUTE A PUBLIC RECORD, AND THEREFORE, MAY BE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST IN ACCORDANCE WITH IOWA PUBLIC RECORDS LAW, IOWA CODE CHAPTER 22.

title: Press pass used by Officer Sandele in Ekelund investigation (LA County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Press pass used by Officer Sandele in Ekelund investigation (LA County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

On July 20 2012, Dateline NBC released an episode titled “The Night Lynsie Disappeared” about the 2001 disappearance of Lynsie Ekelund. In this episode, Detective Larry Montgomery and Officer Spring Sandele share details about the investigation and how they solved the case.

At around the 32-minute mark, Officer Spring Sandele details going undercover as Nicole Anderson, while armed and wearing a wire. Host and journalist Josh Mankiewicz then says Officer Sandele was “posing as a student reporter, complete with a phony press pass.”

I’d like to request a copy of the press pass used by Officer Spring Sandele on this day, likely sometime in October 2010.

https://www.audacy.com/podcast/dateline-nbc-91ef0/episodes/the-night-lynsie-disappeared-12423

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Runa Sandvik

title: CIA assistance to production of "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One" (2023)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA assistance to production of "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One" (2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and the production of the 2023 movie "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One" (also known as "Mission: Impossible 7"), directed by Christopher McQuarrie and starring Tom Cruise. Such documents may include, but should not be not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the CIA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication

I would also like to know if the CIA provided any form of support or technical advice whatsoever to the production of "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One" or to any member of the cast or crew, or if the production or any member of the cast or crew sought assistance from the CIA in connection with the production of the film.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Dept. of Energy collaboration with production of "Transcendence" (2014)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to the filming of the 2014 film "Transcendence," directed by Wally Pfister and starring Johnny Depp, at the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. At least two other films--"Tron" (1982) and "Star Trek: Into Darkness" (2013)--were given permission to use Lawrence Livermore as a filming location, according to now publicly available documents, and the George Lucas-directed movie "THX 1138" (1971) also used facilities in Lawrence Livermore, according to members of the production. Lawrence Livermore, a Dept. of Energy facility, is referenced specifically in the film "Transcendence." I therefore request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of Lawrence Livermore and the Dept. of Energy and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Transcendence," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Appalachian Regional Clean Hydrogen Hub (ARCH2) proposal

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Appalachian Regional Clean Hydrogen Hub (ARCH2) proposal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Applications and correspondence between officials at the Department of Energy (DOE), the consortium named the Appalachian Regional Clean Hydrogen Hub, and the "project development partners"  of the Appalachian Regional Clean Hydrogen Hub project (ARCH2) .

The ARCH2 project is one of seven sites selected by the DOE as a "clean hydrogen" hub, announced Oct. 13, 2023. "Following a Request for Information in Spring 2022 to solicit public input, DOE solicited applications for H2Hubs with a Funding Opportunity Announcement (FOA) in September 2022, and conducted merit reviews of eligible project submissions in 2023."

https://www.energy.gov/oced/regional-clean-hydrogen-hubs-selections-award-negotiations

The ARCH2 consortium includes the project development partners as follows: 

https://www.arch2hub.com/pdps/

1. Air Liquide
2. Clearway
3. CNX Resources
4. Dominion Energy
5. Empire Diversified Energy
6. EQT
7. Fidelis New Energy
8. Hog Lick Aggregates
9. Hope Gas

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A spreadsheet, text file, or other machine readable document(s) containing all emails sent or received from a White House email address from January 1, 2000 to January 20, 2001. In particular, I am requesting the data contain the following columns: 
- email address of the sender
- email address of the receiver (including ccs)
- Date and time email was sent
- Full legal name of the sender
- Full legal name of the receiver (if they are a White House employee)

If the dataset that crosswalks email addresses and names is a different file, I am happy to link it with the main dataset myself. 

Please note that I am not requesting any information about the subject or body of the emails.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Ben Goehring

Dear U.S. Navy:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act. 

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to the Navy and Marine Corps energy conservation mascot, a light bulb named Brite. 

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, development, creation, and design of the Brite mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to the military's decision to create an energy conservation mascot in the first place. 

Note: According to the attached records, Brite was developed by members of the Naval Facilities Engineering Command (NAVFAC) Northwest, Public Works Department in Kitsap, Washington. So please be sure to search there.

2. Please produce all Brite-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, photographs, videos, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any life-size Brite costume (pictured in the attached records). Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Brite.

5. Please produce all correspondence related to Brite (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. U.S. Senator Jodi Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some responsive records. 

6. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision by the Navy or Marine Corps to stop using Brite as part of its public outreach.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Memo
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the memo found in this article: 

Excerpt here: "In a June 4 memo labeled “Guidance,” Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter outlined a subtle shift for the Pentagon’s renowned Office of Net Assessment and its new director, retired Air Force Col. Jim Baker. With Carter’s memo, the office, which traditionally looked towards the horizon when it comes to defense concerns, will incorporate more of today’s issues in its analyses."

https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/checkpoint/wp/2015/06/10/pentagon-chief-issues-new-marching-orders-for-yoda-office/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

George Johnston

10/31/2023 Re: Public Records Request, dated 10/30/2023 File #W054192-103023 for Other Public Records Matter – Clarification of Request Needed Dear Rose Terse: 
On 10/30/2023, you submitted a public records request to the City of Kent wherein you sought Other Public Records for: Most recent FAA Certificates of Waiver or Authorization (CoAs) for all drones/UAV/UAS currently operated by your department. The City requires clarification of your request before it can proceed.  However, I was unable to contact you by telephone to obtain clarification.  Therefore, by this letter, the City requests you provide clarification of the following issues: Which department are you seeking records for (ie Parks, Police Department, Multimedia)? The City will wait for your clarification before it begins gathering any records that may be responsive to your request.  If you fail to clarify your request within 30 calendar days from the date of this letter, the City will close your request. Sincerely, Tiffany Alcorn Tiffany Alcorn CPRO - Lead Public Disclosure Administrator City of Kent Administration 
Arthur “Pat” Fitzpatrick, Chief Administrative Officer
